greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number of connected components of the strict integer partition with FDH number n.
comment: Given a finite set S of positive integers greater than one, let G(S) be the simple labeled graph with vertex set S and edges between any two vertices with a common divisor. For example, G({6,14,15,35}) is a 4-cycle. A set S is said to be connected if G(S) is a connected graph.
example: Let f = A050376. The FD-factorization of 1683 is 9*11*17 = f(6)*f(7)*f(10). The connected components of {6,7,10} are {{7},{6,10}}, so a(1683) = 2.
results.author: _Gus Wiseman_, Jun 10 2018
